# I'm a psychologist studying how we construct, interpret, and apply evidence in psychological and medical research.

I am a researcher at [Charité Center for Patient-Centered Outcomes Research](https://cpcor.charite.de/en/) & completed my PhD at [VU Amsterdam](https://research.vu.nl/en/persons/constantin-yves-plessen).

</div>

</div>

---

## Research Areas

My work spans two complementary domains in the evidence generation pipeline:

**Psychometrics & Measurement Development**
I investigate how we can best measure important domains such as physical functioning, pain interference, and depression from the patient perspective. This includes examining [measurement invariance across cultures](https://doi.org/10.1007/s11136-024-03866-y), developing [reference values for clinical interpretation](https://doi.org/10.1097/CORR.0000000000002798), and [overcoming floor and ceiling effects](https://doi.org/10.1302/2046-3758.1210.BJR-2022-0457.R1) in outcome measurement.

**Research Synthesis & Meta-Science**
In so-called multiverse meta-analyses, I run thousands of analytical variations on [psychotherapy](https://doi.org/10.1136/bmjment-2022-300626) and [digital interventions](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jad.2024.10.018) for depression. This approach examines how analytical choices shape conclusions about treatment efficacy.
